intro: Caenopteris novae-zeelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand shield fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. Caenopteris novae-zeelandiae plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stability and providing shelter for small organisms.
